DOC.HEAD: Tenant Behind in Rent Wins Shouting Contest
DOC.TEXT: A tenant behind in his payments pushed his vocal chords to the limit by shouting, ``Hey landlord, wait three days more for my rent!'' to win the annual Halls Year-End Loud Voice Contest. Hiroyuki Saito, 28, hit 120.0 decibels on the sound meter on Wednesday to win the ninth annual shouting contest along with $360. Toru Komoriyama, a 24-year-old television reporter, took second place by hollering, ``I want to be rich!'' Komoriyama warbled the meter at 117.9 decibels and won $215. Company employee Shigemi Okada, 27, shrieked ``Don't use chicken in the beef barbecue!'' at 115.9 decibels to take third place and $140 in the raucous contest, held outside a Tokyo train station. In the special ``unique shout'' category also carrying a $140 prize, student Kosuke Ushijima, 22, bellowed ``Gorby, you're doing a good job! Best wishes with perestroika!'' won for the men in 110.7 decibels. Lovesick Hisayo Nishikawa, 25, yelled ``Hideaki, please wait for me in New York! I'll go next year!'' in an ear-piercing 112.6 decibels to take the women's prize. Hideaki, a man's name, was not identified. A telephone ringing registers about 50 decibels, while traffic noise is about 100. One risks one's hearing at 150 decibels.
